intro: Achomanes, commonly known as the "buttercup" or "false buttercup," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange flowers with five petals and numerous stamens. They typically have palmately divided leaves and are found in temperate regions across the Northern Hemisphere. Achomanes species are often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Some species are considered invasive in certain areas, outcompeting native vegetation.
